title: Riot why are Turrets made out of Wet Toilet Paper?
body:
Turrets feel like they are made out of wet toilet paper and the problem just gets worse each season. This season if you get cheese ganked before 10 minutes, one time, there goes your turret 100% to 0% before you can get back to lane. If they bring 3 or 4 people on the cheese gank, there goes both of your turrets.

And with the game being so focused on high dmg snowbally champs at the moment, 1 turret down often results in the game being over by 13 minutes with no way to turtle or come back. This isnt helped by the fact that turrets seem to do no damage to champions past the 10 minute mark. Plus the new siege rune and the Rift Herald are to easily abused by snowbally teams and completely overkill as turrets are already squishy as is.  

Not asking for anything drastic just asking for you to at the very least change the wet toilet paper turrets into dry toilet paper turrets that take a little longer to take down. Games were meant to be 35-60 minutes long not this new dream of 15-30.

Listen to your community for once and get the LCS visions of 15 minute games out of your eyes please Riot. This game has so much potential if you would only focus on the gameplay once again and not focus on making LCS more flashy and exciting.

Sadly, I have to agree. I started somewhere around the end of S2 - picked up Fiora then, with Madred's Bloodrazor being my core item unless I felt I could spam 5 Tiamats + LW. Those were the days: finishing before 40th minute mark was actually challenging, and games lasting over 50 minutes were not so uncommon. It all revolved much more around scalling and decision making, there was always a chance for comeback, everything could be countered as defensive and offensive measures were all balanced (despite stacking Tiamats xD). But these days?
Papers and tanks alike explode on touch, as if soap bubbles floating around. Turrets fall at 6th minute mark due to overwhelming damage fiesta. Chances for a comeback? Null, cause a losing team cannot abuse their turrets like they used to, simply because turrets don't last 15 seconds anymore and, well, deal close to no damage.
This game has become really disappointing.

It's almost impossible these days to come back from a loss unless the other team massively screws up, and that isn't what a good well balanced game should be. 
"The team winning by 10 minutes wins unless seriously screwing up, or the other team has a late game mega steroid champion like Twitch". 

That's just messed up on so many levels for balance. 

But alas, that's what riots gone for, and what they have. A game who's balance doesn't actually exist, but revolves around snowball mechanics and steroid overdose champs who have insane power output cuz you have x, y item and are past 10 mins.. 

It's become a snowball vs steroid game. Instead of skill, and ouplays vs skill and outplays.
